commit_list.message:
Fix wrong setup step

`eval "(phantomenv init -)"` is different from `eval "$(phantomenv init -)"` with the $ sign. The $ sign is needed for a subshell returning a string, so that it can be later evaluated.

commit_list.message: Stop using aruba through its step defs, use it through its support code

No need to require a lib/* file through its expanded path

Cucumber 1.3.0 already adds the lib/ dir to the load path.
https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/History.md#130

Convert specs to RSpec 2.14.5 syntax with Transpec

This conversion is done by Transpec 1.5.0 with the following command:
    transpec -f --keep oneliner,have_items,its

* 20 conversions
    from: obj.should
      to: expect(obj).to

* 19 conversions
    from: obj.stub(:message => value)
      to: allow(obj).to receive(:message).and_return(value)

* 16 conversions
    from: obj.should_receive(:message)
      to: expect(obj).to receive(:message)

* 10 conversions
    from: == expected
      to: eq(expected)

* 1 conversion
    from: obj.should_not
      to: expect(obj).not_to
Add the new binstubs to the project
Update RSpec dependency to the 2.14.0.rc1 version
Update Cucumber and RSpec to the latest versions
Configure travis to run the build in ruby 1.9 and 2.0
Make the Cucumber suite green on Ruby 2.0
Improve the use of the ubiquitous language
Little correction on guess letter's cuke
Improve the semantics of the matchers used in specs
Last cukes for guessing a letter
The use can fail guessing a letter
User can guess a letter with success
Start to control the game with a explicit state variable
Add a state attribute to Game
Cukes for guess letter with success
Ghering of "guess letter with sucess" scenario
Extract the GameFlow class from the Game one

to the "comecar jogo" feature
Change step to match feature spec

First scenario of the first feature

gem.

commit_list.repo_description: A simple compiler built during the languages and compilers course in Poli-USP

commit_list.message:
Now we have a rake task to run all the tests.

1. The task that runs all the tests is the test:all one.
2. Besides that new task, we have two more tasks, clean and clobber.
These two new tasks can be used to delete temporary and final files generated
by the test (or build) process. You can check more about that here:
http://docs.rubyrake.org/tutorial/chapter02.html
commit_list.repo_description: A simple compiler built during the languages and compilers course in Poli-USP

commit_list.message:
Big refactoring on the Rakefile

Now the tests tasks are better and more organized. We are almost just compiling
what is needed, I mean, files that were modified.
commit_list.repo_description: A simple compiler built during the languages and compilers course in Poli-USP

commit_list.message:
Updates the docs link from rdoc.info to rubydoc.info

RubyDoc.info is a new guy in the ruby community that was built to replace Rdoc.info. Actually, RubyDoc.info is a result of the merge betwenn yardoc.org/docs and rdoc.info.
Fixes a little mistake in the README
